text.h2: Yeaa ... My Page Is Still Working in [year] !!
text.pLead: In this repository - and on the following React.js app - I publish my graphics made in pixel art style.
text.p: The graphics are used across my other projects. I aim to store the xcf-s in the docs, to bookmark the best free tutorials to make pixel art and of course a new excuse for creating another React.Js app with the help of Bootstrap 4 :) The first pixel graphic I made:

text.pLead: Edward the Mild is a character made for side scroller game for later usage.
text.p: The current image is a frame of a sprite sequence for pixel art-style side scroller. The drawing was done in Gimp with brushes on multiple color layers, then it was pixelized with the usual 50 x 50 grid method.
This is a drawing of an old-school computer (286 PC). Sometimes I feel my i5 laptop is slower than these machines were...

text.pLead: Pringlebel the Dim is another character made for the mentioned side scroller game in 2019.
text.p: The current image is based on the Edward the Mild character and is a frame of a sprite sequence for pixel art-style side scroller. The drawing was done with Gimp with brushes on multiple color layers, then it was pixelized with the usual 50 x 50 grid method. ... Well actually it is just Edward re-colored.

text.h2: I draw this girl for the first character not to feel that lonely
text.pLead: The second pixel art I made. Nothing special: a girl (bit taller than the first character) drawn in pixels.
text.p: The drawing was made with Gimp on a 50 x 50 pixel grid just for fun, it was not published elsewhere.

text.pLead: It has been said that astronomy is a humbling and character-building experience. There is perhaps no better demonstration of the folly of human conceits than this distant image of our tiny world. To me, it underscores our responsibility to deal more kindly with one another, and to preserve and cherish the pale blue dot, the only home we've ever known.
